Dialogs.Text: LostDecipher2: This is strange, what's with the name of this picture?
MsMaki95: Well... It's glitched, i think.
LostDecipher2: I can tell this is not glitched by the fact that this is readable.
LostDecipher2: Yeah, in fact, this was quite standard in the time i used this place. When it was not abandoned.
LostDecipher2: What you are seeing is the full URL of the image that the picture is trying to show. It happens when the program cannot find it.
MsMaki95: I see, but even then, the name at the end is all messy!
LostDecipher2: Whoever made the image didn't seemed to think a good name for the image and so... That's the result.
MsMaki95: Now i want to find whoever made this and have a little talk. Naming is not only for organizing, but show what you want to express with your art.
LostDecipher2: You can do that with the naming tool of the chat, it doesn't matter what name the archive has.
MsMaki95: What are you talking about? Of course it matters, it shows how much you care about the stuff you are doing!
MsMaki95: I didn't expected that you showed that lack of appreciation, mister!
LostDecipher2: Woah woah, ok, i'm sorry... It's just... Ah... I'm not and artist and i didn't knew that and...
Thomas B: Wow, how intense she turned all of a sudden! Now what do i say?
MsMaki95:...No, i'm sorry, i think i went a little far.
MsMaki95: But still, it's something i think one should pay attention to. You know?
LostDecipher2: It's ok, don't worry. And i understand.
Thombas B: Leaving passion and intensity aside, it seems that the image file is missing. Interesting.
